description: Erection of single-storey rear extension at lower ground floor level; installation of rear windows; replacement of front windows and other associated elevational alterations; creation of lightwell access in front garden; and installation of front fence.
decision_conditions:
Detailed drawings/full particulars of the proposed development showing the matters set out below must be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, in writing, before any relevant work is commenced. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved which shall be implemented in full prior to the first occupation of the development.

a) Detailed 1:20 elevations of the proposed new and replacement windows and doors showing the pane pattern and 1:5 sections showing the materials, glazing bars, frames and glazing units.

b) Detailed 1:20 elevations of the proposed cornice with moulding to match the adjoining property at number 70 Downham Road. 

c) Detailed 1:20 elevations and sections of the new stair within the front lightwell. 

d) Elevations and material details of the bike and bin store. 

e) A landscaping plan including details of hard and soft landscaping. 


REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is satisfactory and does not detract from the character and visual amenity of the area.

<p>Prior to superstructure works, detailed specification and a drainage layout of at least one suitable sustainable drainage system shall be submitted to, and approved by the LPA. If soakaways i.e. plastic modules and soakaway rings are used, an infiltration test must be carried out to ensure that the capacity of the soil is suitable for infiltration. It must be demonstrated that there will be no increase in surface water flow being discharged offsite and an overall reduction in peak flow rate and volume.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the interest of sustainable urban drainage.&nbsp;</p>

<p>Full details, with samples, of the materials to be used on the external surfaces of the buildings, including glazing, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority in writing before any work on the site is commenced. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is satisfactory and does not detract from the character and visual amenity of the area.</p>

The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.
